data: Immigration Policy Changes in 2025: Justice Denied During the First Year of the Second Trump Administration Last Updated January 21, 2026 Topics Federal Administrative Advocacy Donald Trump marked his return to office for his second term on Jan. 20, 2025, by immediately issuing multiple executive orders and policies that severely restricted immigration and immigrants’ rights in the United States. The pace of policy change did not ease during the year that followed. This resource provides an overview of what happened in 2025 in various aspects of immigration law and policy, how it impacted CLINIC’s network of legal services providers across the country, and how to get involved in advocacy in 2026.
